content: scrappy knit project bag fully customizable by fairily fiber fun knit from the bottom up with a double layer base this simple little project bag can be knit out of leftover yarns handspun yarns of varying thicknesses scraps and any combination written for two very different gauges and yarn sizes makes this pattern perfect for any yarn any needle size and any scraps follow the recipe to make your perfect project bag and customize to fit your project size needs yarn suggestions around 8-10 ounces of wool 230-280 grams ● wool or wool blend yarn bulky weight ● multiple strands of fingering sport or dk weight wool or wool blend yarns held together to create bulky weight ● any dk weight yarn for fine gauge version of this pattern ● worsted cotton yarn if you are feeling adventurous ● scraps of any yarn you have on hand measurements without blocking bottom of finished bag in both gauges - 8 inches or 20 centimeters that is 4 inches or 10 cm from center cast-on to turning edge a purl round is worked between the base of bag and sides knit your bag as tall as you want it to be for your needs and your yarn this bag is finished with an i-cord drawstring or ribbon woven through eyelets around the top for easy closure this cord doubles as a carry handle techniques used magic cast-on i used judy s magic caston knitting in the round increases decreases picking up stitches eyelets standard bind-off and i-cord gauge 14 sts and 22 row per 4 inches or 10 cm on us 10 6 5 mm needles 25 sts and 38 row per 4 inches or 10 cm on us 4 3 5 mm needles abbreviations ● k - - knit ● p - - purl ● sts - - stitches ● st st - - stockinette stitch fabric is all knit on one side all purl on rhe other ● kfb - knit in the front of a stitch and before removing from left needle knit through the back of the same stitch ● yo - - yarn over ● k2tog - - knit 2 stitches together as if they are 1 ● m - - marker ● bor - - beginning of round ● borm - - beginning of round marker ● sm - - slip marker ● dpns - - double pointed needles tools to knit this fun project bag you will need ● a set of 5 dpns size us 10 6 5 mm us 4 3 5 mm ● 24 inch circular in the same size * note 16 inch circular needles will not work for this project as the base of your bag will not want to bunch up around the needles * ● optional dpns in one size smaller than your main project needles for i-cord drawstring ● 8 stitch markers i used them to mark increases/decreases on the base making sure 1 is a different
